messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Christie's March Sale
messages.msgSnippet: Lot 0218 A Lacquer Box of Arrows Edo period (19th century) The rectangular storage box lacquered black with paulownia crests in gold hiramaki-e, the edges
messages.messageBody:
Lot 0218
A Lacquer Box of Arrows
Edo period (19th century)
The rectangular storage box lacquered black with paulownia crests in gold hiramaki-e, the edges fundame, the box designed on the interior with removable cross pieces cut with notches to hold arrows in place over five layers

I have seen this illustrated in a book many, many years ago, so Pete may be right that a collection is being disbursed. The book is buried somewhere amongst my 40-odd years accumulation as it was a "picture" book rather than a "serious" book to be looked after, but I'll never forget that box of arrows. Mmmmmm. If I find the book I'll send along the reference.

Regards,

Barry Thomas.

PS - I'm away for the next week and will be "out of the office"...


----- Original Message -----
From: klepet33319
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, February 25, 2007 2:21 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Christie's March Sale


http://www.christies.com/LotFinder/lfsearch/SearchResults.aspx?
intSaleID=20909

Nihonto starts on page seven. There are some very nice kodogu listed
and I have to wonder if someone is disbursing their collection or if
it's just the usual happenstance? Some nice iron from the Harvie
collection and two kozuka which I believe were on Colin Griffith's
site, one juyo Goto.
I'll buy a lottery ticket tonight just in case. LOL
.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
